lawnlayer

Class Trail

  • java.lang.Object
    • lawnlayer.Trail

  • public class Trail
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Trail(App app, Player player)
      Creates a new Trail object, which concerns itself with the green path created behind the player as it travels across soil.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calculateTrails()
      Called every 10 frames (to ensure any trails are produced only once the player is perfectly on a tile), this method holds the main logic behind appending green tiles behind the player.
      void updatePosition()
      Called every frame, this method updates the basic player attributes for easy retrieval later in the code.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trail

        public Trail(App app,
             Player player)
        Creates a new Trail object, which concerns itself with the green path created behind the player as it travels across soil.
        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet object
        player - the player object travelling along the soil

    • Method Detail

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition()
        Called every frame, this method updates the basic player attributes for easy retrieval later in the code. This method calls crashDetection().

      • calculateTrails

        public void calculateTrails()
        Called every 10 frames (to ensure any trails are produced only once the player is perfectly on a tile), this method holds the main logic behind appending green tiles behind the player. The method splits the behaviour up into 6 cases depending on what the player's current and previous materials are. It calls the methods appendTrails() and fillGrass() as required.
